ALERT
First Day of School to be Changed to August 31!

Parents/Guardians,
As State Department of Education and Department of Health guidelines continue to change, many schools are postponing the start of the school year to incorporate these changes and provide for more preparation and teacher training.
Ferndale Area School District is planning to change the first day of school for K-12 students to Monday, August 31.

The School Board will address this change at the August 19 meeting and the calendar will be officially changed after board approval.

Additional notes:

*The K4 calendar will be updated and parents/guardians of K4 students will be notified of changes particular to this program.

*Classes at the Greater Johnstown Career and Technology Center (Votech) will still begin August 26. Busses will pick up votech students at their bus stops to go to the Votech on August 26, 27, and 28. Students will be contacted with pick up times. Votech students will also be bussed home after Votech on these dates.

Aug. 7, 2020--PIAA postpones the start of school sports 2 weeks

In a press release today, the PIAA Board of Directors will postpone the official start of all fall sports for 2 weeks, until August 24. They plan to work with the Governor's Office, the Department of Health, and legislators to come to a common resolution on playing fall sports. See the attached press release for additional information.
Volunteer practices can still occur. FASD Athletic Director, Steve Clawson, is contacting all fall sports coaches and working with them on plans.

Released April 9,2020 -- Governor announces: Schools closed rest of the year!

Governor Wolf announced today that school buildings will remain closed the rest of the 2019-2020 school year.
The last day of education for all students grades K4-12 will be Monday, June 1, 2020.
After the Easter holiday break, we will begin to plan how to address all the school educational and extracurricular activities that occur in the month of May.
There will be much more information that comes from State Officials, the PA Department of Education, PIAA, and other groups that will direct what happens.
Stay tuned.
Stay safe.
Stay healthy.

Carole Kakabar,
Superintendent
"Together we swarm"

Students, Parents and Community,

According the the CDC (Center for Disease Control) key indicators for flu activity remain high. Ferndale Area School District remains vigilant to help reduce factors that lead to the spread of the flu. We are making every effort to clean every 'touch surface' daily with Clorox based cleaners and disinfectants - surfaces include desks, countertops, door hardware, railings and cafeteria tables. Students, staff, parents and the community are encouraged to take simple, but effective precautions such as:

- cover your cough
- wash hands for at least 20 seconds with soap and water
- use alcohol based hand sanitizer
- keep hands away from nose, mouth and eyes

More information on the flu and prevention can be found at: https://www.cdc.gov/flu/index.htm

If you have any questions or concerns please do not hesitate to contact the school.

Thank you, Dr. William Brotz - Director of Education

Thank you.
Carole M. Kakabar
Superintendent
